page.title: 09Changes In Corston
page.content: {Mr. Jones}told us the amount of traffic has increased a great deal, especially since the{M4 motorway}was built. This has also made the village attractive to commuters, who now make up the bulk of the village's population. For example, it is possible to drive to the centre of Bristol in half-an-hour. Many of the new expensive houses in the village are owned by commuters. The{village school}childen used to walk or cycle to Rodbourne school, now closed down. These days children go by car or bus to{school in Seagry {or Malmesbury. The number of people working on the farms nearby has dropped dramatically.However, some aspects of the village life continue. There is a thriving toddler group, and dances are still held in the parish hall.
